page.title: 08MIDDLE FARM - FELTWELL FEN
page.content: On Middle Farm they grow potatoes, (288 hectares> sugar beet, (250 hectares) cereals, (400 hectares) beans, (192 hectares) carrots, (l62 hectares) and grass (150 hectares) The carrots are sent off for canning, freezing and for juices. The potatoes are sent off for crisps, chips and packing. The fields are worked many times. First they are ploughed then harrowed, rolled and drilled. Weeds grow fast on the fen so the crops are sprayed with weedkillers and pesticide and later hoed. They have a computer at Dairy One which checks the cows body weights, how much food it needs and tells the dairyman everything he wants to know about the cow. At Dairy two they haven't got one because it's too expensive. There used to be a lot more cows than there are now.
